subscribes.name: content-delivery.rejected
subscribes.summary: Event represents the delivery system currently assigned is unable to deliver the content.

markdown.content:
## Details

Following delivery planning, the delivery systems will read the instructions, acknoweldge them and execute them out.

[Inbox](/domains/Content%20Delivery/services/Inbox/) - responsible for the delivery mode _theatre appliance_

[Partners](/domains/Content%20Delivery/services/Partners/) - responsible for the delivery mode _partners (hardrive)_ and _electronic_

All delivery systems will publish an event called `content-delivery.accepted` to acknowledge that the work has been accepted and will be delivered to the destination on time.

<NodeGraph title="Producer / Consumer Diagram" />

<Schema title="Event Schema" />

<SchemaViewer title="Event properties" defaultExpandedDepth='0' renderRootTreeLines maxHeight="500" />


## How to generate ID for content-delivery.accepted event:

To learn how to produce event id, see [event id generation](https://github.com/RealImage/qw-events-catalog/blob/main/docs/event-id.md).

To generate ULID for the event, use the following components

**Timestamp** - Delivery deadline

**Randomness** - ID of the parent (`content-delivery.planned` event)

<Admonition> 
The randomness component should be concatenated without any connectors and sorted in ascending order.

Ordering is for idempotency. Change in the position of value, will result into different ULIDs inspite of same values. 
</Admonition>

### Example:

Say ID of _content-delivery.planned_ event is `pe1`

Then _Randomness_ will be, `1pe`

<EventExamples title="Sample event" />
